intro: Duroia melinonii, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. It produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Duroia melinonii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
